result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 76 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to restitution.  Balance of restitution (payable to Bradley Corp.) to be paid as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE cost/fines.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Lannon Mill Work and Bradley Corp. listed in the Criminal Complaint.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Michael J Harris in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Repeater enhancer is struck.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.



Court orders the following:
9 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-time.
76 Days Credit - IF REVOKED.
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 1 Year.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Lannon Mill Work and Bradley Corp. listed in the criminal Complaint.


RESTITUTION:  $2,286.77 (to be paid to Bradley Corp. - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Apply Bail to restitution.

Costs:  $243
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Michael J Harris in court, in custody (by Video Conference from MHOC), with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.
Attorney was late and the defendant was put away by the time this matter was called.

Matter will be set for Plea and sentencing.
The defendant should be out by then, however, if not attorney Weathers is to notify our office to do an OTP or set up a video conference.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Detainer placed at Milwaukee County House of Corrections.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint or their residences.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Michael J Harris in court by video conference from Milwaukee House of Corrections, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Informing defendant that proper paperwork including indigency evaluation must be completed before an attorney can be appointed.
Filed by the Defendant, stating he is at the Milwaukee House of Corrections and what he needs to do.
